item.title: Report E-2024100705
item.description:
Report E-2024100705

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-31T09:22:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: MERIDEN
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 15, 2024, one (1) 15-gallon drum of UN1791 had faulty packaging and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Services, Inc. (ESI) to remediate the impacted site. ESI personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1791-impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon drum. The damaged 15-gallon drum was placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both drums were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024101320
item.description:
Report X-2024101320

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-18
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A PACKAGE WITH A CORROSIVE DIAMOND WAS FOUND WET DUE TO INTERNAL LEAKAGE. 1X2.5 FLUID GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLE OF GETINGE CLEAN POWERCON ALUMINUM SAFE DETERGENT COVER SEAL FAILED, THE LIQUID LEAKED THOUGH THE CAP THREADS CONTAMINATING THE SIDE OF THE BOTTLE.
